title: All-In-One sizing guide for EKS deployment
content:
An "All-In-One (AIO)" environment refers to an environment with the following capabilities installed:

  • Service Management Automation (SMAX)
  • Design and Deploy (DND)
  • Cloud Management Platform FinOPs (CMP FinOps)
  • Software Asset Management (SAM)
  • Operations Orchestration (OO) Containerized
  • Containerized UCMDB
  • Audit Service

The following are sizing recommendations for setting up an AIO environment on AWS.

The numbers provided here are based on tests in the laboratory environment and are for your reference only. Your implementation may consume more resources or require more resources to perform in an acceptable manner. 

Reference architecture

The following diagram depicts a deployment architecture for your reference. This diagram can help you get an overall picture of the process of deploying an AIO environment on AWS with EKS.

In this diagram: 

  • The Service Management,DND, CMP FinOps, and Audit capabilities share the same worker nodes, RDS instance, and EFS; Containerized UCMDB and OO Containerized use their dedicated worker nodes, RDS instance, and EFS.
  • These capabilities use an RDS high availability configuration, which is recommended but not mandatory. For information about Amazon RDS high availability configuration, see the AWS documentation.
  • CMP FinOps also uses a Vertica database (EON Mode). For information about the Vertica Eon Mode Architecture, you can refer to the Vertica Eon Architecture document. For information about Vertica's high availability (HA) configuration, refer to your vendor-specific documentation. 

AIO size definition

The numbers provided in this document are applicable for setting up an environment of a Medium size defined in the table below. 

AIO  size Maximum concurrent users Maximum number of CIs and Relationships in UCMDB
Medium 1,000 30 million

Resource requirements

The following table lists the minimum resources needed for setting up an AIO medium profile environment in the cloud with high availability. 

Note that the resource requirements here are based on our test environment that meets the following conditions: 

  • The environment is deployed using the enterprise deployment architecture provided in the "Reference architecture" section
  • The environment supports up to 5 tenants
  • The system load is applied to one tenant

A standard AIO deployment includes EKS worker nodes, EFS as storage, and RDS and Vertica as databases.

Worker nodes requirements

Service Management,DND, CMP FinOps, SAM and Audit use shared worker nodes; Containerized UCMDB and OO Containerized use dedicated worker nodes. 

Capability Type Volume Quantity
Service Management,DND, CMP FinOps, SAM, Audit m5.2xlarge 100 GB 6~9
Containerized UCMDB 3
OO Containerized 2

 EFS requirements

Service Management,DND, and CMP FinOps use shared EFS; Containerized UCMDB and OO Containerized use dedicated EFS.

Capability Type
Service Management,DND, CMP FinOps, SAM, Audit Bursting mode
Containerized UCMDB
OO Containerized

Database requirements

Service Management,DND, and CMP FinOps use shared RDS; Containerized UCMDB and OO Containerized use dedicated databases.

Capability Type Storage Quantity Max_Connections
